section.p: The use-case is that you need to include some external data that is supplied as Excel table. This might be the case when the file is generated automatically – e.g. as some kind of report – or it is generated by hand from people without the skills and/or tools to create DITA content. Beside the CSV format Excel supports an XML format as well that not only stores the data but also all the formatting. Since it is an XML format it is being passes as xcr:source attribute.
The first line of the first table will be treated as header.
